Every time we're there, she's there and comes to say hi, When we met her, we had found out our friend was moving overseas, so we were upset. Then when we came back for her going away, she was there too and stopped by. She even remembered the night we all had tears in out eyes. 

I love the food here! The firecracker shrimp and jerk shrimp are my favorite. I like my food with a little kick and these deliver. Firecracker shrimp comes with a really good dipping sauce, while the jerk shrimp comes with Cuban bread. Also love their drinks! I get the Frozen Bahamarita. I recently tried the specialty rum drink they had, and got a souvenir glass. 

For my birthday, I had planned on coming here for lunch after some activities. After telling my mom, she later told me that they were going to take me there for dinner! lol they know where to take me, that;s for sure. 

Some nights they have live music, but there are always different parties going on.I really enjoy coming here because the food is good, staff are friendly and I always have a great time coming here.

If you like spicy, I recommend that your try the skillet simmered jerk shrimp.
It's cooked and served in a hot skillet smothered in butter and herbs and has a nice spiciness to it, but it's not too spicy. It's also served with fresh baked Cuban bread which is great to sop up all the juices with. For an entree, I ordered the baby back ribs which were decent and came with fries. I'll definitely come back just for the jerk shrimp!

Came here for my friends birthday party and the happy hour menu was amazing!!!!! OMG sooo much drinks and appetizers for such a low cost. 

You have to try the Ultimate piña Colada. If you like sweet drinks then... Please do yourself a favor and order one lol happy price is only $4.
Foods great happy hour even better! You can get your drink inside a pineapple, or coconut!  How awesome is that, even procing isnt outrageous considering how close they are to the strip!
One of the BEST restaurants in Vegas! This West Indies Curry Chicken is delicious and reasonably priced. Umbrella drinks make you escape from reality. 4 stars for sure!
Great Happy Hour! Food is good my favorite thing on the menu are the Jamaican jerk chicken wings. They have so much flavor! The drinks are great and the servers are always friendly!

This is my second trip here and my first in quite some time. The food was really good and the drinks more so. I had two Bahama Mamas and we ordered the Fire-Roasted Jerk Shrimp and Crab Claws St. Thomas for appetizers. For our meal my wife and I split a hamburger. Our waitress was fun and paid attention to detail. Too bad the kitchen staff didn't. A friend of ours ordered the Chicken Sliders. When they came they were do it yourself. The buns, chicken and toppings all came seperated. As for our hamburger that we ordered everything on the side and sure enough it came all assembled. Hey, kitchen, here's a clue. Listen to your waitress. They usually know what they're doing and when you don't listen you wind up hurting them and your business.

3 stars for the fire cracker shrimps and customer service. But the Calypso shrimp linguine is absolutely disgusting, also do not order steak from this place. No seasoning and just wasn't good quality steak.
Always a must when we come to Vegas from LA. Great atmosphere, great service and great food

Where do i begin, this place is FANTASTIC, the decor is beautiful. Takes up the corner spot in a large shopping center, big parking lot. Came in Fri 1/15/16 around 8:00pm, the lot was full but to our surprise there was no wait, the restaurant is huge. The staff are great our waiter Fred came over within a minute of our sitting down and gave us a rundown of the best & most popular drinks & dishes since this was our first visit. My daughter that doesnt drink, loves strawberry lemonade and orders it whenever its on a menu, she says this was the best shes EVER had. All i can say is this place is now in my top 5 of places to have a great "experience" meal. To me, the prices are low for the quality & quantity of food we received, if it were more i wouldnt complain. We were so stuffed couldnt try dessert. They do have small plates so we might do that with drinks next time so that we can try those delicious looking desserts.
I always get the Caribbean jerk chicken pasta.  I love it ! YUM
The only delicious thing on their menu was the mango mango drink (on the kid's menu) sad! I ordered the coconut shrimp and had to substitute their sauce for something else.

Ugh, so many people that I know like this place, but I don't get it!  I've been here a handful of times because it is right around the corner from my office.

Located on the corner of Flamingo & Paradise, there is indoor and outdoor seating and a decent amount of parking.

I came here last week for lunch with 5 of my co-workers.  They ask where we would like to sit.  We asked if we could sit in the "patio" area; its this big round room and the windows can open when it's nice outside.  So they take us to the table; there are only 3 seats.  We look at the guy that brought us to our table and we say "this table is a little too small, there are 5 of us" and he says "yes, I know.  I have no idea why they brought you out here.  Unfortunately, there isn't any tables out here big enough for your group."  We tell him no problem and sit us wherever there is room.

He takes us back inside to the room behind the bar and sits us at a table that is set for 4 people, but enough room for 5.

We ordered a handful of appetizers and each of us ordered entrees.  I ordered the combination chicken & veggie quesadilla and a caesar salad.  The caesar was barely dressed and wasn't that good anyways.  Now, I've had the lobster quesadilla here before and it was gross.  So I thought chicken and fresh vegetables couldn't be that bad.  Well, it's not good.  I don't know how to put it.  But the flavor sucks.

We get a discount to eat here because of where our office is located and I would STILL never come here again.

I wanted to try something new so we decided to give this place a try. It was such a great experience and a nice change to all the all you can eat places in town. The menu was mouth watering and so was the food. I had the Calypso Shrimp Linguine and the portion was so big that I had it to go. The waiter even added a little hand drawn picture of a sailing boat on top of my to go box which was kind of neat. My hubbie and I had the linguine for lunch the next day. I added green onions, sake and garlic to it and it was delicious! Our drinks were great too. Its not a surprise that this place was packed for a tuesday night. The only downside was the garlic bread. It was a little soggy. In all I think that this is a great place to hang out with friends or your significant other. Can't wait to go back...

Live Music on the Enclosed Patio, while eating Carribean food near a fire pit on a cool December night...... Loved it!  Great waiters and management shows passion and professionalism at this location.  At the time of visit, our Restaurant dot Com certificates were honored and made the experience even more enjoyable.  Black Bean Burger (vegetarian style) and Rice Bowls were on point. Virgin Pina Colada was a bit on the sweet side, but no complaints!  The pineapple salsa....  a MUST have with Sambosa. 

Great location, away from the strip, but close enough to main streets.

The food here is great...I loved almost everything we ordered.  Especially good was the jerk Jamaican chicken...annoying to eat the wings but the spices made it worth the bother.  Their seafood Paella is very yummy.  Drinks are pretty strong...especially the mojito.  If you want something sweeter, try their coconut pineapple martini.  For appetizers, I liked the coconut shrimp, calamari, and spinach artichoke dip.

Their bathrooms are really nice too.  They have nice smelling lotion and mouthwash.  Service is pretty good.  There is a large patio which is very convenient if you have a big party.

First of all our waiter Charles T. was one of the best. The atmosphere is very beachy. Loved the food! We got an appetizer of lobster and shrimp quesadillas that were awesome. The hibiscus and mango margaritas were decorated so beautifully and tasted great. Very good prices for being so close to strip.

Service was great, food was great and not very expensive, atmosphere was very nice. The only downside was the drinks were a little pricey which considering its Vegas, probably very common. We came on a Friday night at 630pm and had no wait. Definitely worth coming

We decided to avoid the craziness of the strip & come here for dinner last night, thinking it would be less busy. It was a lot less busy but very understaffed. We had to wait almost 40 min for a table for 4 at an almost empty restaurant. We were seated at around 10:30 pm. 

To be fair - the food was not bad. What was most upsetting is that I ordered the rice bowl with shrimp & fish. A few bites in, I bit into something hard. I thought it was a fish bone but it was a sharp jagged piece of a plastic - probably the remnants of a food container about an inch long and wide. I told the server & she asked if I wanted my dish replaced and I said no as I did not want to wait for another plate at that time of night as our kids were very tired. She showed the plastic object to her manager & I was waiting to see what he/she would say or do. Well the disappointing outcome is they did nothing. No apology from the manager & we got charged for my dish. Very disappointing.  

This is not the first time we have found unwelcome objects in our food at restaurants. In fact once at BJ's my sons Mac & Cheese had the corner of a plastic bag in it but we did not say anything as it was large enough to see & not harmful. The sever saw it as she collected the plates & reported it to the manager. She came to our table to apologize & said we would not be charged for the dish. 

So to the manager of the Bahama Breeze - your management skills need some fine tuning to say the least. Your food quality control obviously needs some work. It's not OK to find sharp plastic objects in our food & it's especially not OK for you to ignore it. Very disappointing.
We went here for lunch and drinks. We had several appetizers, drinks and entrees. It was all delicious! Our server Joe was awesome as well. Will definitely come back!

Last month was my first time checking out their happy hour. & let me just say.. amazing!! Great prices on great drinks and food. Bahamaritas are my favorite. A must try! The sangria was ok.. not the best, but hey I drank it anyway. I also got a Blue Moon which I love. As far as food goes, we ordered most of the happy hour menu. Lots of food! The only reason I'm giving them four stars is because the service was pretty slow. It took foreeeever to get the check and then even longer to pay. But overall, very nice happy hour experience. I've been many times not during happy hour and I always get the jerk chicken pasta. It's soooo good!

After dinner drink and snacks on Wednesday, 8/5/15 (first time visiting)

I came with a huge party of about 40 people. It took about 30 minutes to be seated in the cabana area. They have a parking lot but it got full pretty fast. The servers were friendly. We grabbed drinks from the bar area while waiting for our table.

Outside the restaurant near our tables, they have a performer playing live music. There's a dance floor too.

The appetizers we had were average tasting. We ordered the coconut shrimp, chicken wings, onion rings fried with coconut flakes, garlic shrimp with bread, and mojitos. 

I haven't gotten a chance to try items off their regular menu. In terms of enjoying ourselves for late night entertainment and light refreshments, it was great especially with 40 of us all together. They were able to split our checks too.

My wife and I had been to three Bahama Breeze locations: Raleigh, Seattle, and Las Vegas. We  revisited the Las Vegas location yesterday. 

The first thing we order, directly after the drinks, is the beef empanadas. Just as they were at every other location, they are unmatched and delicious! We went at lunch time for the first time at any location hoping to get a variation on the menu. We were pleasantly surprised. We got the lobster quesadilla combo with a caesar salad. The caesar had slightly too much dressing incorporated into the salad, but the amount of lobster and shrimp packed into the quesadillas made up for that minor hiccup. Great food and atmosphere as usual. Special thanks to the host staff at the front who were very hospitable!

You better get really drunk because the food is horrible.   This our 3rd and last try at this place. We ordered conch fritters.just ok.  Chicken empenadas that were wet inside and doughy..disgusting taste. Sent it back for chicken curry rice bowl.  It was a small amount overall with about 5 small chunks of chicken. .the flavor was so so but after biting into a piece of chicken fat,and gristle that did it.  My guest ordered mahi tacos..it was,and griffin thin sliver of dried fish..looked like jerky more than fish.  Tge visit before we had a chicken pasta dish that was like a parmesan soup...Truly a terrible cooking.  We had a gift card which had money on it after we paid the bill...we gave it to another table as we won't be going back.  That's how bad it was.  Being locals..they must be staying in biz off drinks and tourists.

We decided to veer off the Strip in search for something different and not "Strip-priced" and ended up at Bahama Breeze.

We were pleasantly surprised at their menu, as they offered some of our favorite types of food!  I ordered the jerk chicken wings (of course!) and my daughter ordered their West Indies Patties.  Both were awesome!  The service was also good and our drinks were never empty.

We will definitely keep this place in mind next time we're in town!

Wandered into Bahama Breeze on Memorial Day Weekend and were seated right away. The restaurant is fabulously decorated in a tropical island theme and overall is a good place to go and avoid the chaos of The Strip.  

Whether you sit outside or on the patio, you will get the feel of the islands. Although the food is good, it can get a bit pricey for what it is. I had the Jamaican grilled chicken and it was $18. Tasty but $18 is a bit steep. My wife had a sandwhich for around $12.

The signature Mojito, "Mojito Cubano"  was overly fufu.  They pack the drink with ice and make it like a slushy.  I asked for my second with significantly less ice and it still had too much.  

Given the ambiance and good food, I have given 4 stars.  I look forward to going back.
Good food and place to bring large parties.
Was here for dinner, onion rings were good but huge so were the conch fritters. Our waiter Brandon was funny and helpful with suggestions. Love Bahamas Breeze!

A friend treated me to lunch recently, and a treat it was.  The food was fresh, hot, service was good, and I will return, and don't mind paying.  The prices are reasonable considering the quality of the food, and location.

My wife and I have dined here a few times and thought we had found another favorite. 
The Habanero wings are good. The Key Lime pie is very authentic. However when we decided to go there for my wife's birthday we were extremely disappointed. I ordered Jerk Chicken. I ate about half of the chicken when I realized it was getting difficult to pull the meat from the bone. This generally means chicken is undercooked. When I showed our server he called over the manager who insisted she have it remade for us. I told her I didn't really want a remake. So I opted for it to go. I was really disappointed when I told them it was my wife's birthday and ordered Key Lime pie expecting they would make her feel important with some sort of Birthday thing. But what we got was a waiter who said " pretend I sang for you and then you blew out a birthday candle then walked away. 
I will never go back to Bahama Breeze nor do I recommend them to anyone else. I can see now why they were not busy near the strip on Friday night. Diners Beware!!!

Almost perfect. The service was super slow. I still tipped 10%. I was at the bar. So no excuse there. The food tasted  excellent and alcohol are awesome. Price is neck breaker on regular days!!! Go at happy hour!!!

Came here after the longest plane ride ever from Charlotte. Rode around and discovered Bahama Breeze. Me and my friend figured that since the parking lot was full at 2pm on a Friday afternoon...the food must be pretty good. We decided to order our food To-Go and the hostess was very helpful offering some recommendations. We order and we sit around chatting and people watching. After 15 minutes, our food is ready!

I ordered the Oak Grilled Chicken Sandwich with lettuce, tomato and goat cheese on Ciabatta bread....AMAZING! The chicken was tender and juicy and well seasoned. The cheese was slightly melted and the lettuce and tomato were fresh and tasty! I ordered the tomato, basil and balsamic vinegarette salad on the side. I ate that on the way back to the resort so fast..I couldnt really tell you how it tasted...so I assume it was good. After the sandwich and and ice cold beer, I slept for hours :) 

Bahama Breeze?? You have a satisfied customer here! Now...build a restaurant in Virginia/DC area please!!

Again i experienced a well prepared meal here at bahama breeze!.... It all began with my servers aley & jason they both displayed professional & vivacious attitudes!.... The service & food are always prepared to perfection. I strongly recommend anyone to come in and experience a wonderful time!

Great place to go for happy hour, apps, drinks and beer are cheap, they got some great food too and I love this place, they have a few sides for a patio with palm trees all around to give you the island feel lol

This place is AWESOME!! Doesn't matter what you order. 

They aren't playing around here! Happy hour on point and the drinks are strong! 

YEEEEE!! :)

Good food, good service, nice decor... I'm having trouble thinking of any bad things to say about this place.

Located off the strip near the Hard Rock Hotel, Bahama Breeze was a delightful place from beginning to end.

Our server was friendly and attentive.  I ordered the Seafood Paella without the sausage, which our server said could be done.  One of the chefs came out a few moments later and said that the paella was made with the sausage in it and that they would be picking it out, which was fine with me so long as there wasn't any sausage actually on my plate.  I really appreciate this gesture because I know that not a lot of vegetarians would be cool with that.  When it came, I devoured it, which wasn't easy because it was a big plate of food.

My wife had the Fresh Pan-Seared Salmon Pasta, which was also amazing!

We had a couple of their specialty mixed drinks, which are not on the on-line menu so I don't recall the names.  But they were also very tasty.

Seems to me like most of the good food in Vegas is off the strip, and this would be a perfect example.  

We shall return!

My waiter was great thanks Adam, but who ever the cook was didn't know what came on the plate. My plate looked nothing like the plates of past dinners I was a little disappointed because when you have your mind set on that meal that's what you expect sadly I wouldn't suggest it to anyone unless there going for happy hour.

Walking into this place gives you a relax feeling of being on the beach. Customer service was real good from our server. Took a little long for our food to come out and it wasn't layered with Apps first then meal. Other than that service was solid. I had the Habanero wings and firecracker shrimp to start and both were delicious. Followed it with the Cuban Sandwich. The sandwich was good but tasted a bit bland for my taste. Once I asked for the extra mustard it was good. I would definitely come back when I am in Vegas. I do recommend you stop by and have try!!

I had the very bland fish tacos and my husband had the fried chicken. The service was friendly but the food is was very disappointing, because it didn't have much favor. We asked our server for various sauces trying to add taste to our meal but it didn't improve much. We won't be back.
The lunch specials are great for a great price. I would not recommend sitting in the outside "covered" area because it has poor ventilation and it always hot and muggy. Other than that, great
Today was our first visit. We've driven past this place for years. So glad we decided to give it a try.

Absolutely love this place, every time my friends and I don't know what to do for dinner, we always head here. Waiters/waitresses are always nice, speedy, and the price is very good for the amount of food that they stack on your plates.

Very nice place. very delicious food. but no traditional cuisine. This is a common food for Americans. Fried shrimp...., it's too simple American menu. the Cuban menu or the Caribbean. This kitchen has a different meal choices. But if you're not a gourmet Caribbean cuisine. This restaurant quite a come down.

Loved my food and my drinks.  Yolanda was my waitress and she was nice.  I loved their margarita sampler.  It was more than I expected it to be.  Chicken empandas, the house salad and the chicken bowl were awesome. I wish there was a location in Southern California.

Lobster and shrimp pasta was the best pasta I have ever tasted.

The server was knowledgeable about the menu and offered several suggestions. Lemonade was best I have tasted. Portions were too much for me to eat. Enjoyed the rest of it in the morning in the hotel room. Overall awesome experience.  

I visit Vegas for all Mayweather fights so this place is definitely on my short list.

Every time that I've come get I have never been disappointed. For all those looking for a restaurant that has a great atmosphere, excellent service and bomb food, you have to try this place.

Happy hour at this place is worth the money!!! But when its not happy hour, its still worth coming to no matter what. Let me recommend a few things on the menu:

Habanero Wings- OH MAN, I don't eat a lot of spicy food but this one is so delicious! It has a mix of a sour cream and pico de gallo dipping sauce. All I can say is all the flavors is like a party in your mouth! I was cleaning up the bone and I never do that lol! The blend is perfect! This is a MUST ORDER when coming here! 

Jerk Chicken- Love the seasoning on this. I know they marinade it overnight and put it in the frier to give it a lil crunch. Lemme tell you this, they know how to season this to perfection. Love the sauce to add too, its a touch of sweetness. The combination together is like heaven

Beef Empanadas- Great starter, ALWAYS good to order before the food is coming, they use the same sauce for the habanero wings. Still, the pairing is always perfect when it comes to their sauces and food.

Calypso Shrimp Linguine- All the flavors pop in this dish. My 3 yr old son who is a picky eater will share this with me. The portion size is enough to feed me, my 3 yr old and my 8 yr old. This is a popular dish at this place, I've ordered this numerous times coming here. 

Jerk Chicken Pasta- YUM!!! it may not look as appetizing when you see the plate but DANG this one is a must order also. My husband would order this when we would come here until he discovered the....

Chicken Breast with Cilantro Crema- you have to eat each bite with the chicken, mash potatoes and the sauce. You will be craving this.

For Dessert: Order the Banana But Bread Supreme- you will not be disappointed!!!!! 

Can't go wrong with this place, you will never leave disappointed. The ONLY thing I don't like is that every time we arrive, we are always greeted by a homeless person asking for some money. Seriously EVERY SINGLE visit. Other than that, I have no complaints!

Wow what a great place to eat in Vegas !  Food was soo good and service from Tina was superb.  Only thing was that the drinks was a bit light on the alcohol but they quickly fixed it with another.  The place is busy but the times with good people made it fly by.  Definitely would recommend this place to anyone in Vegas and would come back again.  Too bad California can experience this place but would do well if there is one!!

Came for a wedding rehearsal dinner. Before the rest of the family arrived, we sat at the bar and ordered apps and drinks. The pina coladas and lava flows were ON POINT. Thick, creamy, and not the least bit skimpy on the booze. The yucca fries and spinach dip were also pretty legit.

But then when we sat down at our table, the entrees were all appalling. I don't even remember what we ordered because nothing had any flavor. The décor is pretty cool though!

My girlfriend and I stopped here for drinks yesterday. The bar staff was super friendly and we got our drinks quick. The first round was very strong but the second round tasted extremely watered down. Everything we ordered had the same Dark Rum in it so I'm not sure how the taste differed so much. When I told the bartender we were ready for the check he acknowledged my request then ignored us for at least 10 mins. I finally had to ask another staff member for the check.

nice atmosphere but our server wasnt the best at her job. She kept looking at me and asking for my id and my husband had it our drinks were good but took forever food was was excellant ill go back but would like another server who loves her job

I went here Monday night with girlfriend's Cuban family with high expectations because someone recommended it to us. Exterior was very fancy, and beachy. The restaurant is bigger than I thought with many sections. 

I scrolled through Yelp to search for references of what to order. My family end up ordered Cheese Curds (cheese stuffed fried yucca) Jamaican Jerky Chicken, Seafood Paellas, a stack of Short Ribs BBQ, Cheddar Burger and fries sweet plantain. We loved the Cheese Curds. They were crunchy, cheese oozed delicious. We ended up with two orders of that. The Jamaican Jerky Chicken was delicious, the portion was huge! Half a chicken grilled with special sauce and yellow rice with fried sweet plantains. The plantains were thick cut and fried to perfection. We Cubans loved it. The Seafood Paellas were not that great. The consistency wasn't really true Paella but the flavor was there. The seafood wasn't as fresh, mussels slightly overcooked, though fish was flaky and cooked well. Paellas weren't impressive, average, but portion was also very big! Each can easily feed two people. My sister-in-law's burger was good (you can't go wrong with burger they should all taste how they should taste). My BBQ ribs were ok, again, they tasted just like how should taste. Sweet and smokey. There wasn't any special twist or spin added onto it. 

Overall the experience was meh. With the bill $120 in total, we expected more. It was filling but wasn't satisfying. I heard good things about it, but maybe we ordered the wrong things because everything was just ok.

I used to work for Bahama Breeze, St. Louis, so I looked forward to going in and critiquing how this one was run.

The salmon I ordered was delicious, they have taken off the island rice, don't like the new rice. 

Service was good as usual, the servers are always very knowledgeable about the menu and they did not charge me to make a weird substitution. 

The garlic mashed potatoes recipe has clearly changed and they were very....well...shiny? If that makes sense, it was clear to me that they were not handmade or fresh like the used to be, so sorry, you lost a star over my potatoes.

Overall, enjoyable, they have very good specialty drinks. Bill was about $55.00 dollars before tip for three people, with one specialty drink on the bill and no desserts.

I was so disappointed with both the food and service!   I ordered grilled halibut with mango sauce.  When it finally arrived it was no longer hot, and even with the sauce, it was so dry it was like eating a crunchy newspaper.  
The two other people with me ordered starter plates that sat in front of them long after they were finished.  Presumably this was when our order should have been put into the cook?
The waiter came to ask how our food was when one person had already finished and the other almost so.  I told him what was wrong and he offered to replace it, but it was too late.  : /  Sad to have not enjoyed my meal - but the company was GREAT!

We were looking for a reception site for our wedding that was laid back and would give us more time to actually mingle with our guests.  We decided on Bahama Breeze, and it was great!  The food was fantastic!  Our reception was at 9pm so we did the appetizer buffet for about 25 people, and everyone loved the food!  The atmosphere was light and fun, and I think everyone had a good time!  The only reason I only gave it 4 stars was because a few times throughout the night the staff would come up to me and ask me what to do or what needed to be done, and I kind of felt like it should be their job to already know what should/needed to be done.  Other than that the staff was very friendly and we enjoyed ourselves!

Love this place, nice ambience, has live music playing on the outside patio. Love the Jamaican jerk wings. The Cuban sandwiches are amazing. Everything I've tried here so far was really good. Just wish this place wasn't so far away.

Worst service ever. Came here with a group of 8 people from work. Came in the girl (blonde hair) said it was happy hour then charged us for our drinks and said "did he tell you that?" She must have been training but she was the one who said it. Then she didn't offer to fix anything and continued to have a dirty look on her face the rest of the time. Thanks. Never coming here again!
We love this place! Our family of 5 tries to eat here whenever we are in Vegas. The food and cocktails are awesome, and the staff is always friendly.

Happy hours my thing...but I do not recommend going here for it. Bartender makes a stiff drink maybe too stiff and when it comes to the menu his recommends were poor we got the two spiciest things with no warning. This comes from a person that hates spice. When I go to a bar I like a personable bartender that asks what do u like what don't you like and when you get a response of oh I mainly just make drinks that turns a customer away. This the reason we left.

Went here for lunch today after a long day at the Convention Center for the builder's show.  It's approximately two miles away and conveniently located on Paradise and Flamingo.  You walk in and definitely get the vibe of being in the Bahamas.  Fresh water flowing, tropical decor everywhere and many choices of rum mixed drinks with flavors that bring you back to paradise at sea.

Items Ordered:
- Firecracker Shrimp (Appetizer)
- Jerk Chicken Fettucini (Entree)

My initial appetizer was quite good and I'm not sure what the sauce was made from, but it was very flavorful.  Was definitely in the caliber for bang bang shrimp from Bonefish Grill.  The jerk chicken Fettucini definitely had a nice kick after each bite and made my taste buds crave more.  The portions for both entree and appetizer were extremely generous and I'm so glad I split my meal with my wife.  I really wanted to try the pineapple mixed drink, but unfortunately I was in working hours.  I'd definitely like to come back for happy hour and try other items on the menu.

Best place to have lunch and or dinner. I have gone with the kids (terrible 2's) and on a date night. They have been so accommodating to anything . The food and atmosphere is great. I'm not sure of the name of it but the pork with plantains appetizers are outstanding.  Love coming here.
Haven't a negative thing to say, perhaps the pleasant greeting from all 3 beautiful Ladies as we entered, and Randy our server handled it well.
I was recommended the coconut shrimp and I was not disappointed by the coconut shrimp tacos I ordered. Yum!
Love this place!!! Great place for visitors from out of town or for special occasions. Food and greats are exxxcelent

I've always loved Bahama Breeze and this location is no exception.  The coconut shrimp and seafood chowder soup is my favorite.  The fish tacos looked awesome and is on my list for next time.  The service was friendly and quick too.  Love the tropical drinks especially the painkiller and coconut mojito.

Great layout, music, etc; relaxing atmosphere. 

I was in Vegas for a work convention (exciting, I know) and on the way to the airport, for the last couple of hours, I wanted something quick and easy... but relaxing.  My local friends wanted to meet here for Happy Hour.  

I got here around 4:30 on a Monday.  I really love being able to just park and walk up in Vegas. Eating on the strip is a whole process of parking and walking through casinos... that's like a wasted 20 minutes there, another 20 back.  A place like this, nice and easy.  

The layout is great.  It goes for a Caribbean/Cuban feel, especially outside, without feeling cheesy.  Nice shutters on the enclosed patio area, warm air coming in, sunny... just a very relaxed atmosphere where you really don't feel like you're in Vegas.  I felt like I was on vacation, actually, which sounds cheesy but it's true.  The restaurant was pretty open, though, but it was a weekday.  

Now, the food...

Happy Hour is an amazing deal.  It's like $5-something per dish and beers and drinks are from $2-$3....!?  What... the... hell!  So good.   

We were starving so we got almost one of everything; the jerk chicken, pork sliders, burger sliders, empandas, quesadilla, coconut shrimp, etc.  Everything was great.  My friends were a little hesitant about the jerk chicken because it was black, due to the rub, but it was great.   My friends had a pineapple coconut martini (great), mojito (they loved it, had real sugar cane), I had a hefeweizen.   

So basically, you can't miss at Happy Hour - everything was great.

This is a small detail that I really appreciate. In the men's bathroom, they have mouthwash dispensers. It's a great touch because, let's be honest, your breath after eating isn't going to be the best so this is a great way to hit the reset button. 

It was just a fun, casual experience... it really felt like we weren't in Vegas, but on vacation.

Tempted by Caribbean food we headed to Bahama Breeze.  What we really found was very bad Caribbean inspired chain restaurant food with fake enthusiastic waiters.

Everything is god awful.  Tasteless processed shrimp, fried chicken straight from the freezer bag, fake Caribbean food, obesity sized portions, to over bearing super enthusiastic waiter that just wants to sell sell sell... it was a disaster.  You could stick a knife in his gut and he would still smile and say that was the most thrilling fun he's had he ever had and then try to sell you a tasty signature yummy cocunut piss flavored drink.

For the first time ever, only half the food was eaten and doggie bags were clearly declined.  I felt so cheated, I honestly thought this was a non-chain, real caribbean restaurant.

My wife and I just stopped by this place and we checked the reviews on Yelp and we came for lunch. We definitely enjoyed this place. It is a mixed of Caribbean food. Really good. In addition my wife order a pinacolada. She loved it. It has a little splash of run. If you don't like too much alcohol this is for you otherwise you can order something different. I ordered a margarita mango. This one, I really don't recommend it. Not a good taste. I couldn't found the taste of the mango. It was more alcohol than anything else. Next time I may tried something else. Very affordable and great food.

I ate here for the first time the other day, and I have 0 complaints! I was a little skeptical because I've never eaten at a Caribbean restaurant before but the food here is so so good!!! The waitress that we had was amazing as well, she was so funny and genuine. I would definitely recommend this place, and I can't wait to eat here again!

Great, beautiful, and perfect priced! I do reccomend the Jerk Shrimp Appetizer and the Banana nut covered in brandy sauce for dessert.. So delicious  The service here is very calm and assertive to your need and delivers well. Sunday through Thursday they have happy hour after 9 til close and all appetizers are half off great deal!! Come and try it yourself #jerksauce is good on everything

Located on Flamingo Blvd, just east of the Las Vegas Strip. Ok so it's a chain, I have no problem with that. This is a great place to take visiting family if you want to avoid the strip. The service is great, the prices good, and food is fun. Oh and they have a great selection of drinks as well. What else do you need? Nothing you say? Good, then stop on by. Live it up you are in Las Vegas for cryin' out loud!
Bahama Breeze Grilled Chicken, TO DIE FOR! So so good, and my boyfriend ALWAYS orders, Calypso Shimp Linguine....LOVE BAHAMA BREEZE MY FAVORITE!   VERY DELICIOUS!

Came here with a local after needing a change of scene in Vegas.   It was still prop-ish but atleast you did not feel overwhelmed with so many people like in the hotels.  Food was decent, not the greatest just somewhat different and there was live band.  Not really some where I would come to Vegas for.

Bar/drinks review only. Great happy hour prices. I like the Aruba Red (beer) which is only at Bahama Breeze. I haven't had the food in a long time just because I tend to opt for healthier choices at other places, and I can't remember it well enough to write any opinion on it. I love to stop here for a drink from time to time.
I always love going here with friends for fun and yummy food and great island cocktail concoctions!

My wife and I wanted to find a restaurant that had good ratings, was something that "locals" would eat at, and was OFF The Strip.  This restaurant fit the bill perfectly.  Service was speedy, both in seating and in getting our food.  Our server was Sam and she was quite pleasant and knowledgeable, even joking around with me after I made some of my usual sarcastic comments.  I had asked her what was good here and what she'd recommend and, when she told me, I said that I'd trust her and that it would be her fault if my dinner wasn't great...all the time with a smirk on my face.  It turns out that she was right.  One of her recommendations was the seafood paella.  It was the first time I'd had paella and it was awesome!  She asked me later on why I hadn't left her any so that she could have some dinner that night and I said that it was just too good to leave behind.  We both chuckled and she said she was glad to hear it.  The pina colada I had was really good, but stir it up first.  Most of the rum goes in first and is then swirled in with the rest of the drink which resembled a very thick milkshake's consistency.  Yum!  I can easily see myself returning to this restaurant the next time I'm in Vegas.

Very reasonably priced food.  Lots of seating and a good size parking lot.  There were 18 of us.  They waited until we were all there; then we got seated in the outdoor patio. 

A husband/wife team took care of us.  And they took the initiative to ask how many separate checks did we need.  How often does that happen?

I ordered a new item - mahi mahi and shrimp with lemongrass rice bowl.  Great ratio of seafood and veggies.  I would order it again.
I've been coming here on and off for over two years and the food has retained its quality as well as the professionalism of staff. The food is still great and I'll be back again and again.

Never been here before, but I had a gift certificate. My daughter & I came. We started out with ultimate pineapple drink. Yum!! Ordered spinach dip. Super yummy.  Then dinner. We both ordered the tenderloin pork with sweet potatoes. It came and my daughter is allergic to mango. We thought we read it carefully. It said nothing about the pineapple salsa, which had mango.  Our server (Travis) was awesome he took it away & made her a new one without salsa. Will definitely look for another Bahama Breeze near us. Great job.
I always receive great customer service definitely a favorite spot when looking for a place to sit and unwind.  They treat Vegas locals good.

When will you put a Bahama Breeze in SOCAL? I love this place! The appetizer cajon shrimp platter with bread is the best thing I've ever tasted.  I have been writing letters to the company to expand westward for years, but no feedback and no outcome :( BEST FOOD EVER!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Delish! I had fish tacos which came with huge chunks of avocado and super scrumply seasoned black beans and rice.

Service was good, if a bit phony.

Bathrooms: Lotion, hairspray, AND mouthwash. I was bitching all weekend about how bathrooms should have lotion and voila! Also mouthwash is a totally nice touch, more places should have it.

If for any reason i'm lurking this part of Vegas again, I would return.

This place has great happy hour specials! Plus they start at 9pm which is earlier than most places in town. 

The appetizers were all really good and the selection of drinks is pretty extensive. 

My only complaint would be the drinks are more sugary than strong. I need a little more liquor! But I still come here pretty often. 

I would definitely recommend checking this place out.

Had a retirement party for a friend, 20-25 people were there, they shoved us in a small room with the fire pit in the center, some ppl had to stand due to the lack of chairs and tables, the service was absolutely terrible, very slow, some ppl had to go to the bar for their own drinks. My drink was basically a slushy with shot of tequila on the side , I had to drink some of the slush in order to get the tequila to fit in the glass .. Knowing how many ppl were there they only had two servers and one bus boy .. You could tell the girls were over whelmed and it showed in their service and attitude.. Some of the appetizers were bland , such as the spinach artichoke like dip was extremely watery and had ZERO flavor, the smoked wings were tough , the only good thing were the coconut shrimp.. I use like eating there , but after this , I probably won't return .. Party or not !!
I was there yesterday for mothers birthday had such a great time minus some waiting but we caught happy hour was amazing Steven was awesome thanks for your services!!,

This place is a total joke. Our server was an absolute jerk who refused to give us menus because we sat down in the bar table area without getting menus from the dimwitted hostess. Then he went off on a tangent about how there was a miscommunication and we should not have been seated without menus. He is the definition of a low wage uneducated worker. So then i go to the bar and tell the bartender i want two drinks for me and my date (who looked better in her photos ) and he says he will let our server know because im in his section. I go off on the dude because i just want to get two drinks and carry them the 2 feet from the bar to the table right behind me, but he refused to do this cause it wasn't fair to the server. What a bunch of degenerates at this chain hell. The manager came over and eventually offered to buy me 2 drinks, but hell no because he defended his erver. Ended up walking out on my ugly date, who was sitting at the table wondering what the hell she should do and also this Bahama Breeze forever. Letter to corporate also sent, but a canned response was received. Punks.

Service 5/5
Food 4/5
Cleanliness 5/5
Decor 5/5

Came here today and was pretty impressed by the waiter and the wide selection from their menu.  My favorites are the bahamarita, conch fritters, and lobster Shrimp quesadilla. Definitely a repeat!

I am a big fan of this place! The restaurant itself is pretty huge and they do a terrific job maximizing the space and setting a great environment. There's a very diverse drink menu for anyone's needs. The Bahamarita is the way to go in my opinion. After two or three, you can't really feel your face. They have an awesome menu as well that has something for just about everyone. My girlfriend never orders anything but the Caribbean Jerk Chicken Pasta, which comes in a huge portion that can be shared or taken home for a second meal. I myself love the Steak Oscar, which is an 8 oz sirloin topped with buttery crab meat. How can you beat that?! They also have a great happy hour for those who are lucky enough to work close to the Strip but luckily, there is a reverse happy hour that starts at 9 as well.

Decided to try it because it was within walking distance of our hotel. Started out strange with the host commenting that we were different because my wife and I sat together in a booth instead of across from each other. Didn't get much better from there, server had to be asked several times for the beer that had been ordered, two rounds, two sets of excuses why we had to remind her. We were in a booth near the POS and got to listen to the disgruntled servers the whole time we were there. The food didn't make the experience any better, lacked flavor and seasoning. Would be hard pressed to recommend it based on this experience.

I came here for lunch with some coworkers. We work in the Howard Hughes center so it's a convenient place to go for lunch. I was not very happy with the service we received. My friend is vegan and asked if she could make her own salad and the waiter said no and he didn't seem like he was in a good mood...then my other friend asked him what is in the seafood chowder and he said "it's creamy." uhm, yeah I am aware that chowder is creamy but what is in it. I gave him the benefit of the doubt on that because I just assumed he was new and maybe didn't know. 

I orders the tortilla soup and lobster quesadilla. I've had it before and it has never failed. When I got my food, a ton of the soup was spilled out onto the plate that had the quesadilla so my food was all wet and soggy. I posted a picture of it.  I didn't send it back because I was here for lunch and didn't have time to wait any longer because I had to get back to work for a meeting. 

I've had some pretty decent experiences here and the food is pretty good. It's a shame that my last experience here was not great. It could have been that maybe the waiter was new, but who knows.

It was another enjoyable meal at Bahama Breeze!

A bowl of Bahamian Seafood Chowder was good and creamy, but warm rather than hot.  Peruvian Corn Cakes bristling with kernels of yellow corn were quite tasty slathered with butter and topped by a vibrant and fruity housemade Pineapple Salsa.

A Caesar Salad with fresh Romaine leaves and sheets of Mozzarella Cheese was graced with an excellent Caesar Dressing.  And, an abundant portion of sauteed Mahi Mahi with Shrimp Saute in Lemon Cream Sauce that was presented with fine Spanish Rice was moist, flakey, perfectly cooked, and delicious.

Once again, 4-1/2 stars overall!

The seafood chowder has one of my favorite elements - conch! Reminds me of the Carribean. The ultimate pina colada is DELICIOUS but low on the alcohol content. Tasty nonetheless. 

Lots of food for not-that-much-money, compared to the rip-off food options on The Strip. Our waiter even itemized our menu for each person, so we could easily split the bill in our group. Awesome service, good food, definitely coming back here again with friends!

I had my wedding reception there last week, and the staff there was amazing and accommodating. They went above and beyond to make sure my day went smoothly. I ran into a few hiccups during the planning process, but things were always ironed out and fixed quickly. 

The food is OUTSTANDING! My guests ranted and raved about the food, the drinks and the service! 

A big huge thank you to Momi who put up with a briefly stressed out bride during the planning process! 

If you need a contracted event, the staff at Bahama Breeze is able to handle it with attention and professionalism.
The food is good here. Anita is a very nice and attentive server. I would come back forsure.

Caribbean food, they said.. 3.5 stars, they said.. Must be good, I said.. Now my stomach hurts. 20$ Lobster & Shrimp Linguine has no flavor. Onion rings are alright, just big and the onion had chewy skin. Orange juice was very diluted with water. Goat cheese burger has a very strong taste for the cheese not recommended if you're not a fan. Shrimp Calpyso is pretty decent.
At first they were friendly but the guy who took my order forgot my food. Drinks were good. Won't be back. Thank you

As a local, one of my favorite places to go. 2 happy hours and mojitos are amazing. The only reason I didn't give 5 star is the lack of big tv's, sorry but I am a big sports fan. Also I had been a long time costumer, I usually arrive alone to meet my husband later after work and the hostess stuff are far from friendly, is like if you arrive as a woman sitting at the bar does not deserve to be greated!!!. The rest of the stuff are very friendly, from servers to bartenders to supervisors on duty.:).
The place is HUGE inside!!!  The food was really good... the firecracker shrimp were my favorite for the night... only downfall, the service was just a little slow!

My Island oasis in the middle of Sin City.  We come here every time we come to Vegas.  I know you have no clue who "we" are.... but my whole family.  We plan where we are going to stay, club and when we are going to eat at Bahama Breeze.

Let's start with the Cons.... there isn't a location in Southern California.  Then again, id probably spend my rent money eating there all the time.  

The Service: Is always wonderful. Haven't had a bad experience yet.  The staff is always helpful and pleasant.  So cheers to them!

The Atmosphere: Wonderful!  For someone who has been to the "islands" this place is a good representation.  From the ceiling fans to the music being played.  Not loud, but mellow music.  Helps the food go down better... screw the sugar.

The Food:  OMG! Even if everything else was horrible the Food is so good you'd ignore it.

Jerk Chicken- my mouth is watering just thinking of them.  They have the perfect amount of jerk flavoring and are fried or baked to perfection.  Crispy on the outside but tender and juicy on the inside.  We made a mistake of sharing an order. Bad idea.  These are too good to share.

Beef Patties- Yummy! If flavor and good food aren't you thing... steer clear of this option. Truly a mouth satisfying appetizer.

Seafood Paella-So I have had Paella at a number of locations and this is one of the best.  The whole dish is a burst of happiness in your mouth.  I've had this 2 of the last 3 times I went here.  Everything else just doesn't seem to catch my eye.....

Always too full for dessert..... maybe next time.

I've eaten at this restaurant a couple of times and there food is pretty good overall. I like the theme of the place...makes me feel like I'm on a tropical island. I absolutely love their bathrooms...I feel bathrooms say a lot about a restaurant. They were very clean, nicely decorated, full size doors for every stall, big size stalls, and they have mouth wash with individual cups so you can be minty fresh as you leave.

The food:

Lobster and Shrimp Quesadilla- It was good but I imagined something different so it was tasty but I felt it was missing a bit more flavor. Glad I tried it but I'll probably go with something else next time.

Seafood Chowder- That was delicious, had a good amount of shrimp and vegetables and was creamy, I loved it.

Cobb Salad- It was big and came with the usual fixings but I've had better cobb's in my life. 

Coconut Shrimp- Mmm...mmm...mmm...a must if you eat at this restaurant. Perfectly fried and packed with flavor.

Chocolate Pineapple Cake- I don't like chocolate but I do love pineapple and this dessert called to me. It was warm, rich, and melted in my mouth. I suggest sharing because it's very decadent...I needed a glass of water when I finished. 

They have a large menu so there's something for everyone and they have a good selection of tropical alcoholic drinks.

Love the food and the service.  We had the grilled Mahi Mahi with mash potatoes. Also I ordered the lemongrass shrimp and Mahi Mahi, it was a big portion. I recommend the half size portion of your not very hungry. The Night Shift Manager MoMe is the BEST. Also the bartender Jason is also one of the best.
Best service! My sister and her husband had her wedding here! Food was great and they even gave extra! Drinks are excellent too! I love this place!

Bahamas Breeze really is a local gem for Las Vegans. The ambiance is laid back and tropical. They even have a small water feature running the length of the Restaraunt. The staff are all polite and I have never had a bad experience here. In addition, the staff will do anything to make your visit enjoyable (including singing and dancing for my crying 3 year old). 

The drinks here are reasonably priced for the size - they are quite large! And not to mention mixed very well. They taste like kool-aid and, according to my husband, are quite dangerous on the intoxication meter as you can drink and drink as of there were no alcohol - until you stand up from your seat. 

Food: I personally love the jerk chicken pasta. The asparagus and mushrooms work very well with the spices of the chicken and the pasta sauce. The husband loves the chicken salad, and the burgers here are also very good. The portions are large, so a single entree is enough to share between 2 adults, which is nice. 

I think Bahamas Breeze is one of the best restaurants in Vegas. Off the strip. Not too expensive. Good for families. And the food quality is high.

Great food and a great happy hour menu! Perfect for 104 degree weather!!! Their bahamarita is the perfect frozen drink and their sangria get a two thumbs up!!!! Happy hour is the best time to come and get the best bang for your buck!! And the crowd is pretty great!

I do love Bahama Breeze even if it is a bit of a walk from the Main Strip, Its a Caribbean Style Restaurant which just looks like you've stepped into the Caribbean in Las Vegas, All the staff are really friendly and willing to help, We went on a Sunday evening when it was happy hour 9pm until close they also have it Monday through till Friday from 4pm-6pm and Sunday through to Thursday 9pm until close, I had a 20z Beer in an iced cold glass for $3!!!! They have a great selection of beers and cocktails in the happy hour! No wonder this place was soooo busy! They also have a great selection of appetisers half price so we choose the massive Crispy Onion rings! they were huge and so tasty!!! For the mains i had the Jerk Chicken pasta which was good!!! And my partner had the one of the Burgers which was also huge! The portions here are not small so come on a empty stomachl!! The whole place was buzzing and had a great feel to the place and it was nice to escape from the Strip for a while, They also have live entertainment on some nights including some great Reggae and Caribbean tunes so you can just pretend youre in the Caribbean. If youre planning on taking a visit here  from the Strip i would recommend taking a taxi as it is a bit of a walk and the area can be a little sketchy.

This is still my go-to restaurant on my Las Vegas visits... the last couple times have been disappointing though because my favorite menu items were discontinued.

But I decided to try it again and went with something totally new: the ropa vieja sandwich with the side of fruit, no sorbet.

The sandwich was pretty good, could have used something to add flavor or spice but I would get it again.

We LOVE this joint and make a point to go every time we are in Las Vegas!  The food is consistently good and the service has always been wonderful.  You can't go wrong with anything on their menu.  I had the scallops on corn cakes (a special that day) and my husband has had the Jamaican Jerk Chicken the last two times and loved it.  Also the Cuban Bread appetizer is so good.  At then end of dinner I ordered the Almond Mocha coffee drink but had them add their brandy butterscotch sauce in place of the chocolate syrup. OMG the drink rocked!  You have to like sweet coffee, but it was soooooo good!  Casual dining, awesome atmosphere, great servers; a bit pricey but worth every penny!  Enjoy!

Went here last night with my boyfriend. We are slightly new to Las Vegas and I was really craving a burger..like from Chilies or somewhere like that but we neeeed to be trying new places! I remebered driving by Bahama Breeze and hearing good things about it from people. We sat in the bar and we were gonna order a drink but because it was 106degrees outside...we ended up drinking down lots and lots of water. I went for the portabello/manchanga cheese burger and he went for the Cuban Sandwich which made me happy so we could share. I usually lovve any and most syles of the cuban sandwhich. I skipped fries and went for the black bean soup as my side, which was actually delish; they put a splash of some yummy green salsa on top that made this soup perfect. I did try my boyfreind's fris and they were OK, nothing too special but average and tasty. The burger was good, the mushroom and cheese mix on top was awesome! It was very messy tho and I had to cut it in half of course as my his sandwhich came out cut in half and verrry bit. I enjoyed my sandwhich, I just hate when it falls all apart and is all over the place because then I am not getting the full effect of the flovors together. I was eying his sandwhich and finally took a bite, I was not impressed at all....it was slightly dry and was in need of a special mustard of some kind (honey, spicy..something..), it might of had some mayo on it but it just tasted dry, the bread was OK...it was more of a mixed meat pannini sandwhich if you ask me. He did enjoy it but mainly because he was dipping it in his ranch. I actually brought half of it for lunch to work today, added some honey mustard and it was pretty good. The decore in this place is fun, reminds me of Rain Forest Cafe. I would say it is an affordable, family-friendly place that is OK for the food. Our server was great, no issues there. I did see the happy hour menu and will FOR SURE go in for that some time soon but probably just that...1/2 off apps. and cheap fancy drinks. I think it is only Sun-Thurs though. I am looking forward to hitting the happy hour  but think it is more of a family-friendly place with OK food and funky fish/jungle decore.

Most of the time, this place rocks!  The happy hour specials work!  The Bahamarita is, by itself, a reason to come here.  One recommendation that is a have to if you like this place: sign up to get their emails.  Once or twice a year, they have free parties.  You can RSVP for up to five people.  They serve free food and drink.  The last one, they only gave you one free drink (in the past it was unlimited).  BUT I won a gift card to come back and dine.
For regular dinning, the coconut shrimp or the seafood paella.  Yum!

Variety of food and great selection. This place is great if you feel like having a big dinner or small plates and salads. Great service and delicious food. Our server, Jerry, went above and beyond to make out time special. There was also a reggae band playing. All in all, it was a perfect experience. I will definitely come back next time I am in Vegas.

BEST happy hour in Vegas!! $3 for a pint of blue moon (and they have a selection of beer) $5 martini (totally delicious) and their appetizers like Jamaican jerk chicken, empanadas and burger sliders are around $5 as well.  A definite must-try if you've never been!

food is ok.
Specialty drinks are better.

I had a great time. I ordered the paella and it's delicious even though I know I make it great if not better at home. The beef empanadas was slightly greasy but still yummy. The shrimp and crab with the toasted bread was above mediocre. The coconut shrimp was amazing and so was their fried shrimp. The baby back ribs was falling off the bone tender and my 3 year old ate one after another. The jerk chicken taste way better than it looks. The nachos were a classic fave. I know you are reading this and must be like wow this girl eats a lot but FYI I'm pregnant so I have a big appetite. The singer played and sang me Happy Birthday and he sings great music. The waitresses were on point, friendly, and nice. The only thing that could've made this experience better was if my husband was there but I understand he had to work. Someone has to make money but I definitely would go here again and my sister loved it so much she wants to come here on her Birthday. Oh and last but not least the mango beach drink is to die for! Best drink I ever had(non alcoholic)

Seriously? Chicken wings came out in 3 minutes. That's amazing! How can you cook chicken in 3 minutes?
Chorizo sliders were soggy, had to send them back. If you're looking for pre-made food this is your place. If you like good, quality food I don't recommend Bahamas Breeze.

Listen.  When you have a group of 18 to 21 people it can never be easy.  I'm sure the wait staff do not enjoy.  Plus issuing separate checks and keeping it all organized this cannot be an easy task.  Saturday night we were there and it was a very large party.  Jerry and I cannot remember the gals name kept up with us all night.  Very accommodating.  Very courteous.  Very attentive.  It was nice.  The food is ok.  It can cater to a lot of different tastes.  Pasta to steak to hummus and nachos.  Drinks were good.  It can get loud but we've obviously made it one of our stops each time we come into Vegas.  We always have a large crowd when we do our annual trip and this place just gets it.  

Thank you BB.

Where do I start, this place exceeded my expectations and I'm soooo glad we chose this restaurant over the sushi place next door to it. 

We started off with the coconut shrimp, which was delicious (the dipping sauce is really good). We also had the chicken wings and they were flavorful and finger licking good:-)

The mojitos are by far the best mojitos that I have EVER had and I've had lots and lots of mojitos!!! They had just enough sugar and mint and they had a pretty good kick to them, not to mention they were only $4.00 (during HH). Did I mention they had a pretty good kick:-) They were so good, we went back the next day, just for the mojitos (and not during HH - they were $7.00 each). 

For our main entrees, we ordered buttermilk fried chicken breast..OMG this dish is delish!!!!It's a layered dish of mashed potatoes, chicken breast, topped with spinach onions and cheese, and then layered again with another chicken breast and potatoes. On the side, the dish also included corn and black beans drenched in a wonderful sauce.  It sounds like alot and it is, don't worry about that, get a to go box if you have to. This dish is awesome and a must to try. I would order it again in a heartbeat. 

The atmosphere is nice (tropical theme) and the waitstaff was friendly and accommodating. 

Great job Bahama Breeze!
We loved the Cuban Bread appetizer but they stopped serving it. The rest of the food is ok. The best thing about this place is the Chocolate Island desert. The wife likes the Mojitos.

We missed the lunch crowd, so it was somewhat quiet. However, after having a couple of Pina Coladas, my girl friend and I were glad we didn't have to worry about folks thinking we were laughing too loudly! I think I had some kind of jerked shrimp dish, which was excellent. The bartender was extremely pleasant and a native Chicagoan to boot! I will definitely visit there when I'm next in Vegas!

A few of my friends from work and I came here for lunch last week. I really like this place and the atmosphere. It's very tropical and relaxing. I ordered a Bahama Mama and the bar there does a fantastic job with that drink! It was delicious. My food was good and the service was very good. Our server was a very nice lady and she got us everything we wanted with a smile. Very personable. I have been here a few times and I will keep coming back.

Last night 2 friends and I were looking for somewhere to get food and drinks after the fireworks on 4th of July. We tried to go to Herbs & Rye but it was closed! We eventually ended up at Bahama Breeze, and it was honestly a great experience. I have been here a handful of times before and have always enjoyed it. I really love their late night happy hour, although we could not take advantage of that last night because it was a Saturday, oh well. Without a doubt my absolute favorite thing about this place is that every single item from drinks to food to dessert has the CALORIE COUNT on the menu! This is super helpful for me since I log all of my calories daily. I chose the Painkiller cocktail which was delicious, for dinner I ordered the Grilled Chicken Sandwich on a brioche bun for only 400 calories, and I added avocado which was a generous portion and perfectly ripe. My choice of side was the Vine Ripened Tomato Salad which came in a balsamic dressing and was very good as well. I also ordered a glass of Cabernet and it was great. My friends had the Shrimp and Grits which looked incredible, and a steak with mashed potatoes which was perfectly cooked, and a nice looking Caeser Salad and Clam Chowder. I would have liked to order a dessert but there was nothing even remotely low in calories lol. Service was great and we were all pleased with our meals, and I like that they are open until midnight every night.

It's a typical Darden Restaurant. The server was friendly but not very attentive. A manager approached every table but ours. Our appetizer was missing the sauce and no one stop by our table in between the delivery of the appetizer and the entree. I probably won't return to this location.

I LOVE LOVE LOVE this place! We were a group of 10 and we didn't really have any problems with our orders. The food is delicious! The staff is really nice, depends on what time of the day you go to, though. We went during lunch, and it was packed but nothing I couldn't enjoy. I really wish they had this place in California!

It's freakin' 100 degrees in Las Vegas today, so my co-worker says "let's try this place" because he'd been here before and enjoyed the food.

I had to agree that the food was really good.

I ordered the Chicken Club Salad.  Fantastic and DELICIOUS!!!  Right amount of salad, bacon, cheese, dressing and chunks of crispy chicken!!!  Yum yum in the tum tum!!

For dessert, I had a slice of Dulce De Leche Cheesecake.  It was too good.  I could not finish it because I was full and it was very sweet.  This is saying a lot because I ALWAYS eat all of my cheesecake (I'll be working out a lot tomorrow morning in the hotel gym!!!!!).

Our server was friendly, polite and always checking up on us to see if we needed anything else.

Next time I'm in LV, I'll try the clam chowder.  I hear it's very good.

FYI - bathroom was clean.  There was even mouthwash and hair gel near the sink.  Really.

I was there a few months ago but thought people should know if my experience...A few people in my life know I am allergic to seafood and I have to be careful where I eat and drink. However, I sometimes take chances when there is something I have a craving for. One recent night, I went to Bahama Breeze (http://www.bahamabreeze.com) because I wanted their West Indies Patties. The friend I was dining with can't eat spicy food so she asked our waiter Jay for a sample of their jerk sauce  but Jay didn't know  how spicy the sauce was so he went and got a sample for her and the chef Dan Strohecker came with him. Since the chef was at the table I figured I would ask if they use the same oil to cook everything. Dan said he couldn't guarantee that they didn't but especially when a rush comes on. He graciously offered to cook the patties in new oil for me in a skillet. I was floored because that has NEVER happened in any restaurant I have ever eaten at. He said they will do anything within reason to ensure their guest enjoy themselves and any allergy issues are addressed.  I thanked him and he went and got started on my patties. Jay brought them to the table and a short time later Dan came back and asked me how they were and he looked down and laughed cuz the plate was empty. He said there's my answer! He said he had never cooked them that way before and didn't know if they would turn out light and crunchy like they do when fried in the deep fryer. I told him not only were they light but the crunch was unbelieveable. Not too hard and not to soft. Just perfect! I thanked him again and told him I would tell all my friends and blog about it. Bahama Breeze is one of the more successful restaurants in Las Vegas and now I know why! The food is exceptional but the service and attention to customers is phenomenal! Beyond anything I have ever experienced before. They are better than 5 star in my book. When you are there, tell Dan what a wonderful chef he is and request Jay as your waiter. You won't be disappointed at all!

This is now the 3rd time we have been here and they have again failed to disappointment. First of, our waitress was wonderful. Her name is Tina. She was wonderful and friendly. She took her time to explain each item to us. When we did not like a particular drink, she immediately changed it for us. What wonderful service!
Food is enjoyable and portions are big. Tried there Jamaican chicken wings and jerk shrimp. Both were average.

We went here for dinner on 8.12.15 and had a great experience. Our server Tina and her team were very attentive and the food was delicious. Happy hour is good because you don't have to be just in the bar to take advantage of the reduced rate. We have been here several times when visiting Vegas, I wish the restaurant was close to home in California.

We thought we would try this place because we were close by and were in the mood for some fruity drinks. 

I had the skinny mojito and my lady had the bahama-rita. The drinks were the best part of our experience. Both were awesome and reasonably priced. 

We had the fish taco's and a cheeseburger. The fish taco's tasted like a sewer, but my cheeseburger was ok. The quality of ground meat wasn't really of my liking, but the avocado was great. 

This place is huge and it felt like we were secluded in our own little corner--too lonely.  I definately would have preferred to sit closer to the center of the restaurant.  I don't think they clean that part of the building because we saw a lot of dust falling from somewhere right above our food. The table light illuminated the particles as we covered our drinks and plates with our hands. Ummm yeah. A few more drinks and we probably wouldn't have noticed. Unfortunately we weren't that saucy.  

WIth so many good restaurants in the area, I don't think we will be back.

I was looking to get away from the Strip and all the pretentious,  way overpriced food there, when I stumbled upon this place. It was Tuesday afternoon, at least in the 80's. This place is a tropical themed place, with nice covered outdoor seating - perfect! There was a nice breeze & it wasn't  crowded, although I'm sure it is at happy hour & prime times.

Nice menu with carribean influenced items, and drinks. I had a great margarita, coconut shrimp & salad ( lunch special). Good value, and delicious. If I lived nearby, I would be a regular.

This was my first time in Vegas, and the first restaurant, and one of the BEST restaurants we attended while on trip. I kept it simple and ordered the quesadillas, my friend had the shrimp which were big and a generous amount. The food was good and flavorful, BUT the drinks were AMAZINGGGGG!! I'm really into the fruity-tooty, frozen and mixed type drinks, and their menu had plenty of options that were right up my alley. Loved it so much, we made it our last stop before we boarded our rescheduled flight back home.
Love coming here for there happy hour every week. It has great appetizers. I highly recommend the beef empanadas, so good.

Came back tonight & Tina waited on us. The food tonight was to die for. I took pictures of everything we had. I don't know what they did but everything is 100% The music was on point. I will bring friends and family to this location.
Sehr lecker und nicht zu teuer. Die Tische im Aussenbereich sind etwas wackelig und schlecht ausgeleuchtet. Dennoch: Sehr empfehlenswert!

YUM!!!! Can't wait to go again. Service was friendly, food was good. Easy location and easy parking.

Recommendations:
-Bahamian Breeze
-Bacon Cheeseburger
-Shrimp & Chicken Pasta
-Filet
-Potato Fries (? Appetizer)
-Coconut Shrimp

Basically, this is everything we ordered. And it was amazeballs.

This place is kinda depressing. I would normally never go here (or a place like this in Las Vegas) on my own but 'had to' because of a group of business folks I was with. They had live music but it was very drab. Happy hour had decent prices but the food was very underwhelming. Service was pretty horrible so we are assuming the girl was new or trained horribly. I don't recommend unless your car breaks down in front of it and you are starving.

I think Olive Garden could have made a better fish taco. One ounce of cold white fish tucked into a stale flour tortilla with some cabbage. Nope! The second star is for the tortilla soup I got before the tacos, that was pretty delish. Normally I try to give a place the benefit of the doubt but my dining mates described their dishes as "this doesn't do rice a roni justice" and "seems like boiled salad." Sorry Bahama Breeze, step it up!

Not too impressed with this place. For a restaurant in this area it should be a whole better. Our waitress was nice , but not too attentive to our table. The food had a lack of seasoning. The first dish I ordered was $18 , and had to send it back. Talk about bla! No taste. The second dish I ordered was a chicken Spinach dish. Same thing really could if used some salt and pepper . I would of rather gone to Applebee's! If your going to eat in this area ...go to another restaurant. This is the place of fine dinning and great food. No need to waste your time with this place.
We love Bahama Breeze so much we invited over 40 of our family and friends  to join us for our wedding rehearsal dinner! Natalie's staff is amazing. Great food, wonderful staff and fun atmosphere.

I have been here many times and had one very bad experience. I spoke with Dan the manager and he assured me it wouldn't happen again. We went back last week and Brandon was our waiter. I must say he was awesome. Drinks and food all came in a timely manner and he checked on us many times. This is what I'm used to getting at Bahama Breeze. 
I highly recommend this place.  I will be back. Thank you Dan and Brandon.

Everything I got was packed with flavor and my taste buds are a happy camper!   My brother lived in Vegas and this was one of his favorite places and I'm so glad he took us there.  The Beef Empanadas make you say MMMMMmmmm after every bite and for the main course I got the chef's pic of Stuffed Crab, Rice and a savory sauce.  I was so happy that I literally had to go one more time before I left!

I was born and raised in Vegas so whenever I come back to visit I have to come to this place. They need to open up a restaurant in Arizona. My favorite meal is from here and it's a must try, the salmon tostada. The portion is huge, the salmon is perfectly cooked, and the dressing is to die for. Another favorite is the habanero wings, you get a ton of wings since it's an appetizer and the sauce is sweet and spicy. The cocktails are great here and the happy hour deals are wonderful! The service is always great, everyone is so friendly we haven't had a bad server yet. My mom and I come at least every two weeks, sometimes once a week.

My family and I really enjoyed our first visit to Bahama Breeze. I have been meaning to try it for some time. We went in on a Saturday afternoon and they were not too busy. The food was pretty good, but the best part of the visit was the staff. When we first walked in, one of the servers walked up to my kids who were looking and the fountain and pulled two pennies out of his own pocket for them to throw into the fountain. When we were first sat it took a couple minutes for our waiter to come to the table and two of the other servers (who had just gotten off) noticed and without us having to ask went and found our server. Our server was also very friendly and did a great job. My family and I will definitely be returning to this restaurant in the future.

This restaurant reminded us of another Caribbean style restaurant we enjoyed on the East Coast.

The hostess greeted us right away and there was no wait when we arrived around 5pm on a Sunday. We were looking forward to live music but the musician didn't arrive until we were having dessert.

Service was great. Food was good. The jerk chicken wings and conch fritters came with really good sauces. The chicken adobo street tacos weren't the best. It had a lot of guacamole (I love guac) and it had Crispy tortilla strip at the bottom but there was barely any meat. We ended with a rum cake, which was pretty good. We ordered the Bahamarita cocktail and the sangria. Sangria tasted horrible even after they added more juice to it.

They have a happy hour during the week where they have discounted cocktails and half - off most of their appetizers. We will probably end up going back during happy hour to try the other appetizers.

We probably make it here two to three times a year. The restaurant is large enough to accommodate our larger party if our family decides to go there last minute without reservation. Overall, the food is OK, nothing really has ever been mind blowing and nothing has ever been a fail. We like to come here because the restaurant is spacious with a laid back island feel and atmosphere. Service has never been an issue either and we have sat in all areas including the main dining area, the bar area, and in the indoor patio area.

The firecracker shrimp street tacos, the Jamaican chicken wings, and the ahi tuna stack are pretty decent starters. The whole wing is served as the appetizer so be ready to share. For entrees, the paella and the steak oscar have been satisfactory. But the last few visits I have ordered something from the fresh fish menu.

Our last visit was on a Saturday night and we sat in the indoor patio area. They had a gentleman playing live music for our entire stay. The music did not drown out our conversation, but you should request another seat if you would like a more peaceful environment. 

For drinks, we had the Yaka Hula Hickey Dula and the Painkiller. Both cocktails were strong but nice mixes with kick from the rum. They were too strong for my wife, so that meant two dinner cocktails for me. I had the sauteed tilapia with chimichurri sauce as my entree. My wife had a turkey burger. My fish was cooked perfectly, moist and flaky with the chimichurri being a nice accompaniment. For dessert, the chocolate pineapple upside down cake was enjoyed by both of us.

As long as Bahama Breeze continues to be consistent, we will keep coming back.

We love going here! The Jerk Chicken Pasta is to DIE for... 

Anyone who goes needs to try it out!

Although I've only been to Bahama Breeze in Las Vegas once, I've been plenty of times in Jacksonville Florida when I used to live there, even celebrated my birthday there. So I think due time for a review.
